main event: On November 30, 1954, a meteorite fell through the roof of a house in Sylacauga, Alabama, striking a woman and causing injury.
interesting points: The meteorite weighed about 8 lbs. and was approximately 8 x 5 x 3 inches in size.
It fell through the roof, bounced off a radio, and struck a woman, Mrs. Elizabeth Hodges, on the hip.
The incident was confirmed and documented by Lt. Col. Arthur G. Rowe of the USAF.
The weather conditions at the time of the incident were described as partly cloudy.
The ejecta mass was found to be 8.5 lbs., and only one piece of the meteorite was recovered.
witnesses: Mrs. Elizabeth Hodges, Lt. Col. Arthur G. Rowe, USAF
